subject: RE: [junit] Re: How to test private methods in a class.
msgSnippet: ... I find that something similar is true for complex methods. If I find a complex method, that s most often a sign that there is missing an abstraction
messageBody:
> If I decide I want functionality from the extracted class
> accessible from another package, it's usually a sign that
> I've got a new abstraction that's probably worth making
> public. At that point, I'll extract the functionality out
> appropriately.

I find that something similar is true for complex methods. If I find a
complex method, that's most often a sign that there is missing an
abstraction which's introduction would make the code both simpler and easier
to test.

Cheers, Ilja
